text:
"Can this be still a dream?" Raskolnikov thought. 

He stared at the unexpected visitor. 

"Svidrigaïlov! What nonsense! It can’t be!" 

He felt bewildered. 

Svidrigaïlov smiled calmly. 

"I’ve come for two reasons," he said. 

Raskolnikov waited, heart racing. 

"I wanted to meet you," Svidrigaïlov continued. 

Raskolnikov's mind raced with confusion. 

"What do you want from me?" he asked. 

Svidrigaïlov shrugged. 

"Just a conversation, my friend." 

Raskolnikov felt uneasy. 

He couldn't shake the feeling of dread. 

This was only the beginning.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov is bewildered by the unexpected visit from Svidrigaïlov, whom he finds hard to believe is actually there.
